main event: On August 13, 1955, a civilian fire look-out reported an oval-shaped object, red on one side and green on the other, about the size of a quarter at arm's length. The object was seen at the left and right sides from 11:11 pm to 11:13 pm and was still in sight at the time of the report.
interesting points: The object was described as oval-shaped, with one side appearing red and the other green.
The sighting lasted for a couple of minutes, from 11:11 pm to 11:13 pm.
The source of the report was a civilian fire look-out, adding credibility to the observation.
The conclusion was that the sighting was possibly caused by astronomical or meteorological phenomena.
The report suggests that careful attitude should be exercised in evaluating the sighting.
